intro: Daucus gingidium subsp. mauritanicus, commonly known as the Mauritania carrot, is a perennial herb native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its roots are often harvested for culinary or medicinal purposes. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller size and more compact growth compared to other members of the Daucus genus.
